title: Wesley Edge Science to Clinch U16 Rugby Tens Title
byline: Wesley College won the All Island Under-16 Elite Rugby Tens 2025, edging out Science College 5-3 in a thriller at the St. Peter’s College ground in Bambalapitiya.

title: Pradeep Somasiri wins Bronze at World Para Athletics Championship 2025
byline: Sri Lankan para middle-distance runner Pradeep Somasiri brought pride to the nation by winning a bronze medal at the 12th World Para Athletics Championship 2025, held at the Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium in New Delhi, India.

title: US Supreme Court girds for culture wars with LGBT, guns and race cases
byline: The U.S. Supreme Court is set to wade back into the nation’s culture wars during its new nine-month term that begins on Monday with a series of contentious cases on issues including transgender athletes, gay conversion therapy, guns and race.

title: Over 30,000 power outages reported amid CEB work-to-rule action
byline: Over 30,000 electricity breakdowns were reported across the country yesterday due to adverse weather conditions, the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) Technicians’ Union said, warning that restoration may be delayed because of their ongoing work-to-rule campaign.

title: Keeri Samba shortage not caused by me: Dudley Sirisena
byline: Large-scale rice supplier Dudley Sirisena said he is not responsible for the current shortage of Keeri Samba rice in the market.

title: Time with people brings greatest happiness: Mahinda Rajapaksa says
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa said that the greatest happiness a leader can experience comes from spending time with the people.

title: Almost 1,000 trapped on Tibetan side of Mount Everest by blizzard
byline: Rescue efforts were underway on Sunday to clear access to campsites on Tibet’s eastern slope of Mount Everest, where nearly 1,000 people have been trapped by a blizzard that has blocked roads, according to Chinese state media reports.

title: Postmaster General exposes overtime fraud and inefficiency in postal service
byline: Overtime payments amounting to more than Rs. 10 million had been claimed by a majority of postal employees without using fingerprint verification, following over 400 audit queries conducted last year and this year, Postmaster General Ruwan Sathkumara revealed.

title: Johnston says Sampath Manamperi is not his coordinating secretary
byline: Former Minister Johnston Fernando today (5) denied claims that Sampath Manamperi was serving as his Coordinating Secretary.

title: Police nab seven for drug trafficking disguised as fishing
byline: Seven suspects were arrested today by the Matara and Hambantota District Crimes Divisions for their involvement in distributing hashish across several areas in the Southern Province.

title: Billionaire populist Andrej Babis’ party wins Czech parliamentary election
byline: Billionaire businessman Andrej Babis has won parliamentary elections in the Czech Republic, although his populist ANO party fell short of an overall majority.

title: Thunderstorms and heavy rains on the cards
byline: The Meteorology Department has warned of thundershowers and heavy rainfall across most parts of the country today.

title: Hajj and Umrah Ministry confirms all visa types allow holders to perform Umrah
byline: The Ministry of Hajj and Umrah confirmed that holders of all types of visas may perform Umrah while in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

title: Security for Mahinda Rajapaksa assured if requested: Deputy Minister
byline: The government is prepared to provide security to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa if he informs the authorities after assessing his security needs and the threats he faces, Labour Deputy Minister Mahinda Jayasinghe said.

title: Government cannot continue deceiving world as it does its own people: Rasamanickam
byline: The Core Group reminded the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) that Sri Lanka’s pledges remain unfulfilled and every commitment on justice, devolution and human rights has been reduced to rhetoric, Parliamentarian Shanakiyan Rasamanickam said.

title: Govt. must show backbone to probe deals between political leaders and Prabhakaran: SF
byline: Former MP and Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka has called on the current government to demonstrate political will by appointing a powerful commission to investigate alleged deals between past political leaders and the LTTE, particularly during the final stages of Sri Lanka’s civil war.

title: Certain laws have become obstacles in resolving medicine shortage: Nalinda
byline: Certain laws and regulations have become an obstacle in resolving the current medicine shortage, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: English author Jilly Cooper, writer of The Rutshire Chronicles, dies at age 88
byline: English author Dame Jilly Cooper has died at age 88, her family has announced.

title: BIA authorities seize Rs.16.2Mn worth of cigarettes in first week of October
byline: A trader, fisherman, electrician, and a foreign national who attempted to smuggle large quantities of illicit cigarettes into the country, worth over Rs.16.2 million, were intercepted by authorities at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) during the first seven days of October, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Police launch manslaughter probe into India’s cough syrup deaths
byline: Indian police have opened a manslaughter probe into the deaths of at least 14 children linked to a toxic cough syrup, dealing another blow to the reputation of the country’s pharmaceutical industry after a string of similar tragedies in recent years.

title: Deputy Minister warns opposition politicians not to talk nonsense anymore
byline: Deputy Minister Mahinda Jayasinghe said today that politicains such as Wimal Weerawasna and Udaya Gammanpila must be ready to face investigations if they continue to talk nonsense.

title: Bellanwila tusker ‘Manika’ passes away
byline: ‘Manika,’ the majestic tusker of Bellanwila Temple, passed away this afternoon at the age of 76.

title: Former West Indies allrounder, Bernard Julien passes away At 75
byline: Former West Indies all-rounder and 1975 World Cup winner Bernard Julien passed away at the age of 75 in Valsayn, a town in Northern Trinidad. Julien was one of the understated legends of the 1975 World Cup, a tournament that brought immense joy to West Indians 50 years ago as the West Indies team secured the first-ever men’s World Cup title in cricket history.

title: Three women killed, one injured in accident in Gampola
byline: Three women were killed and another person was injured in an accident on the Gampola–Doluwa road this afternoon.

title: Nobel Prize in medicine goes to trio of scientists for discovering how the immune system is kept in check
byline: The 2025 Nobel Prize in physiology or medicine has been awarded to a trio of scientists – two of them American and one Japanese – for discovering how the immune system protects us from thousands of different microbes trying to invade our bodies.

title: BMICH police station reopened after brief, unexplained closure
byline: The police station located within the Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall (BMICH) premises has been reopened, just 24 hours after it was abruptly closed down on official orders.

title: Severe lightning advisory issued for several provinces
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an amber advisory warning of severe lightning in the Northern, North-Central, Eastern and Uva provinces.

title: Met Department website comes to a standstill while weather causes havoc
byline: The Department of Meteorology website has run into trouble due to technical issues as adverse weather conditions caused havoc in some areas over the weekend.

title: French PM and government resign
byline: France’s Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu has resigned, less than a day after his cabinet was unveiled.

title: Supermoon shines over Vap Poya Day
byline: A supermoon is lighting up the sky on Vap Poya Day today, appearing approximately 7% larger than a typical full moon, the Arthur C. Clarke Institute for Modern Technologies (ACCIMT) said.

title: International dhamma programme to mark Vap Full Moon poya
byline: A special International Dhamma Programme will be held online on Vap Full Moon Poya Day, Monday, October 6, 2025, featuring a Dhamma talk on Practical Meditation by Bhante Shravasti Dhammika Thera.

title: President opens archaeological museum and research institute at Somawathi
byline: A newly constructed two-storey building housing the Archaeological Museum and the International Archaeological Research Institute at the historic Somawathi sacred area in Polonnaruwa was officially opened today under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Sri Lanka and Maldives reaffirm commitment to strengthen bilateral ties
byline: Emphasizing the importance of strengthening people-to-people connections and broadening cooperation to enhance the close bilateral ties between the two countries, the newly appointed Sri Lanka High Commissioner to the Republic of Maldives, Mohamed Rizvi Hassen, presented his Letters of Credence to Maldivian President Dr. Mohamed Muizzu at a ceremony held at the President’s Office on Sunday.

title: Sri Lanka CEB tenders 200MW battery energy systems
byline: Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) had called for tenders from potential bidders for 200MW/200MWh battery energy systems (BESS), it was reported yesterday. This is for the upgrading of its grid to accommodate more intermittent renewables.

title: School boy drowns while trying to retrieve cricket ball
byline: A 17-year-old school boy has drowned after attempting to retrieve a cricket ball that had fallen into the swimming pool at his school in Dikwella.

title: Electricity Engineers’ Union to waive work regulations
byline: The Electricity Engineers’ Union has decided to waive all work regulations starting from 4:15 p.m. today, Samagi Joint Trade Union Alliance convenor Ananda Palitha said.

title: Hospital fire kills at least six patients in India’s Jaipur
byline: A hospital blaze caused by a suspected short-circuit killed at least six patients in a trauma centre at the largest state-run hospital in India’s northwestern city of Jaipur, and injured five, officials said on Monday.

title: Drug destruction laws yet to be implemented despite high seizures
byline: Despite promises that new laws would allow illegal drug hauls to be destroyed immediately in front of a judicial officer while retaining samples for legal proceedings, the practice is yet to be introduced in Sri Lanka.

title: Sri Lanka sees 100 new cancer patients every day
byline: Around 100 new cancer patients are being diagnosed in Sri Lanka every day, amounting to nearly 35,000 cases annually, it was revealed.

title: Aluthgama police investigate into alleged sexual abuse at Child Development Centre
byline: Aluthgama Police are investigating into an alleged sexual abuse incident involving an 8-year-old child at a Child Development Centre in the Pinghena area of Beruwala.

title: Farmers warn of artificial rice shortage during festive season
byline: Chairman of the National Farmers’ Union, Anuradha Tennakoon alleged that rice producers deliberately create artificial shortages every year during the festive season, and criticised the government for failing to address the issue.

title: Japan stocks hit record after ruling party names pro-business leader
byline: Japanese stocks have hit a record high after the country’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) named Sanae Takaichi as its new leader, positioning the pro-business politician to be Japan’s next prime minister.

title: 32 Pigeons handed over to Dehiwala Zoo for safekeeping stolen
byline: It has been reported that 32 pigeons have been stolen from the Dehiwala Zoological Gardens.
